title: Ketesnuko
author: Ketesnuko
created_time: March 15, 2023, 11:51:40 AMLast edit: March 15, 2023, 01:58:22 PM by Ketesnuko
content: Before you promote any new altcoin projects, always make sure that they have an ANN available on this forum, so that if they do anything wrong you can accuse them and maybe they can adjust to keep their reputation, I still remember promoting a project long ago and the team denied that they are aware, they did this to avoid paying promoters and the BM went offline, the project is a very good one, it was later I found out that they never add any Announcement thread open on the forum.

comments.author: vv181
comments.body: The bounty manager should be the one who tightly linked to the project, it does not make sense if the BM are just playing around about creating the campaign. Though, filtering a trustable bounty manager should be the precondition before joining any campaign.Lastly, a project announcement thread on bitcointalk should not be a necessity for a project. It doesn't mean anything about the project's legitimacy, and having an ANN thread does not guarantee the project will responsible for anything. Do also note that certainly the majority of altcoin project that popped out is very likely worthless project, you going to have a hard time finding out which one truly trying to build a solution for some problem.

comments.author: Apocollapse
comments.body: The project must be old and good enough, if not the developer can just abandon the project and create another new project without anyone know it. If the project has decent reputation and they don't want to distribute the bounty rewards, their reputation will be ruined and they need to choose to distribute the rewards. There are already a lot new project get negative feedback, it's proving have an ANN thread in this forum doesn't guarantee the project is legit.

comments.body: Quote from: Ketesnuko on March 15, 2023, 11:51:40 AMBefore you promote any new altcoin projects, always make sure that they have an ANN available on this forum, so that if they do anything wrong you can accuse them and maybe they can adjust to keep their reputation, I still remember promoting a project long ago and the team denied that they are aware, they did this to avoid paying promoters and the BM went offline, the project is a very good one, it was later I found out that they never add any Announcement thread open on the forum. There are lots of concept to look out for before promoting or taking up a project for promotion, and for me having an ANN page on the forum is not a pass mark. Instead as a promoter, onus is on you to find out the basic details about the project you are promoting and the bounty manger managing the event. For example, the popular Digitalbits team are very reputable, and popular across Europe; yet they did not reward promoters adequately. So to summarize, theres no right way to avoid such mistake
